intro: Fagelia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty fagelia, is a small evergreen shrub native to South America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that are typically reddish-brown to rusty in color. It produces small, bell-shaped white flowers that bloom in spring, followed by dark purple berries. Fagelia ferruginea is often found in moist, acidic soils in forested areas.
